info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 18 at 10:19AM EDT until March 20 at 12:41AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee FL
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Tallahassee FL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Alabama...
Pea River near Ariton (US 231) affecting Dale and Coffee Counties.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Pea River near Ariton (US 231).
* WHEN...From this afternoon to late tomorrow evening.
* IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, The backyard of a home near U.S. Highway 231 and Pea River will start to flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 12.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this afternoon to a crest of 15.1 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.2 feet on 02/28/2013. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this evening at 900 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE TOMORROW EVENING
